learning_outcomes.description: Use the formalism of quantum information to describe quantum circuits and algorithms
Describe the methods of quantum error correction theory and apply them to correct quantum errors.
Apply methods from quantum noise to describe simple noise processes.
Determine the requirements of physical systems to be good for implementations of quantum information and give quantitative calculations analysing various physical platforms.
Describe and understand the quantum information "stack" from physical hardware to algorithms.

assessments.task_description:
For a subset of the applied class sections throughout the semester a subset of students will be selected to complete a “viva” style question, to be worked through individually and presented individually (no external resources allowed beyond the course notes and textbook).The class will be divided into groups of typically 3 depending on numbers. Each group will present once during the semester during the applied class time.

The assessment will proceed as follows:

- The selected group of students will attend the applied class and be presented the question, and will be given 20 min. to individually prepare notes on the response.

- The students will then take turns presenting their solution over the next 30 minutes (~10 minutes each) with interactive questions from the lecturer.

assessments.task_description:
The written examination will be invigilated on-campus.

During the written exam: answer all questions. Keep in mind that the marks associated with each part of a question are not necessarily an indication of how much time they will take to answer. Try to attempt all parts of each question in order to maximise your marks. If you find yourself spending too long on one particular question, explain how you think your answer should proceed, and move on.

learning_activities.topic:
Group problem solving activity / viva presentation

For a subset of the tutorial sections throughout the semester a subset of students will be selected to complete a viva style question, to be worked through and presented as a group (no external resources allowed beyond the course notes and textbook). The assessment will proceed as follows: - The selected group of students will attend the applied class and be presented the question, and will be given 20 min. to prepare notes on the response. - The students will then present their solution over the next 20 minutes with interactive questions from the lecturer. - The students should ensure that all members of the group participate in the presentation and all the students in the group are expected to respond to questions.
